title: Cells that breathe oxygen and sulfur at the same time
comments_summary:
## The Impact of Stack Overflow on the C Language

This Hacker News comment thread discusses the impact of Stack Overflow on the C language.

## Code Quality

Some users suggest that Stack Overflow has led to a decline in code quality, with many developers simply copying and pasting code from the site without understanding it. Others argue that Stack Overflow has made it easier for developers to find solutions to common problems, which has led to an overall improvement in code quality.

## Learning

Some users suggest that Stack Overflow has made it more difficult for developers to learn the C language properly. They argue that developers are now too reliant on Stack Overflow and are not taking the time to understand the underlying concepts. Others argue that Stack Overflow is a valuable learning resource, as it allows developers to see how other people have solved problems and to learn from their mistakes.

## Community

Some users suggest that Stack Overflow has created a more toxic community around the C language. They argue that people are quick to downvote questions and answers, and that it is difficult to get help if you are a beginner. Others argue that Stack Overflow has made the C language community more accessible, as it allows people from all over the world to connect and share their knowledge.

## Summary

The impact of Stack Overflow on the C language is a complex issue with both positive and negative aspects. While some users suggest that Stack Overflow has led to a decline in code quality and has made it more difficult for developers to learn the C language properly, others argue that Stack Overflow is a valuable learning resource and has made the C language community more accessible.
